[File: consensus/consensus-types/src/round_timeout.rs] [Byzantine: Collusion Attack] Can <1/3 Byzantine validators coordinate their RoundTimeout messages to manipulate honest validators into accepting invalid timeouts? (Critical)

[File: consensus/consensus-types/src/round_timeout.rs] [Byzantine: Signature Withholding] Can Byzantine validators selectively withhold valid RoundTimeout signatures to prevent honest timeout certificate formation, causing liveness failures? (High)

[File: consensus/consensus-types/src/round_timeout.rs] [Byzantine: Split Brain] Can Byzantine validators send different RoundTimeoutMsg messages to different honest validators, causing consensus state divergence? (Critical)

[File: consensus/consensus-types/src/round_timeout.rs] [Byzantine: Reason Manipulation] Can Byzantine validators send conflicting RoundTimeoutReason values to different validators, causing disagreement about timeout causes? (Medium)

[File: consensus/consensus-types/src/round_timeout.rs] [Byzantine: SyncInfo Poisoning] Can Byzantine validators include malicious SyncInfo in RoundTimeoutMsg that passes round checks but causes consensus to stall when later verified? (High)

[File: consensus/consensus-types/src/round_timeout.rs] [Network: Message Replay] Can RoundTimeout messages be replayed across network restarts or validator restarts to manipulate round progression? (High)

[File: consensus/consensus-types/src/round_timeout.rs] [Network: Message Ordering] Can out-of-order delivery of RoundTimeoutMsg messages cause validators to accept timeouts before receiving the corresponding proposals? (Medium)

[File: consensus/consensus-types/src/round_timeout.rs] [Network: Amplification Attack] Can sending a single valid RoundTimeout trigger cascading timeout message propagation, amplifying network traffic? (Medium)

[File: consensus/consensus-types/src/round_timeout.rs] [Network: Message Flooding] Can attackers flood validators with RoundTimeout messages for future rounds, causing memory exhaustion storing pending timeouts? (High)
